page.title: 09History of Litherland
page.content: In the Domesday Book,Litherland was pronounced as litterland or liderland which means "sloping land". A Dane named Uctred owned Litherland. In 1770 the Canal was built and in 1774 the first Packet sailed.The Packet was a passenger boat from Liverpool to Bootle. St.Philip's School was built in 1867 and it was enlarged in 1881.In 1861 before the school was built St.Philip's church was built ,at that time all of Litherland was nothing but fields. Before St.Philip's new school was built they had lessons in a room above the stables at the Litherland Hotel which had been converted into a chapel. The population of Litherland during the last two decades has grown from 2,500 to 10,000,this was due to the building of a railway.
